answers.answer: Hi there.I understand your concern.  Diabetes makes the body prone to neuropathies, especially peripheral neuropathy which affects the distal hands and foot.  Your symptoms may really be due to nerve damage, however, it is very hard to say or ascertain if the blood pressure cuff could have actually caused the damage, though by proximity of events, it is also very hard to discount the possibility.  I suggest that you seek consult with another doctor, as there are good medicines that can address and relieve neuropathic pain that he can prescribe.  Massage therapy also works for some people, even alternative treatments like accupuncture.  I hope you will be rid of this pain as soon as possible.  Regards and God bless.
